document_data.mainbody: '''Ogrillons''' ({{Pronounce|o|GRIL|unz|refs={{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|28}}}} {{Pronounce|AG|ril|unz|refs=|alt=yes}}) were the result of [[orc]]s and [[ogre]]s breeding.
document_data.Description: Ogrillons looked very similar to orcs. Roughly 10% of ogrillons inherited the physical attributes of their ogre parentage and were clearly distinguishable from other orcs.
document_data.Behavior:
Ogrillons lived in tribes. They often cooperated with orcs and were regularly used by orc groups as extra muscle.

Despite little use for [[currency]], ogrillons often considered [[gold]] coins lucky and most ogrillons carried coins with them.

Although most ogrillons pursued [[barbarian]] or [[fighter]] roles, some chose to become [[shaman]]s.
document_data.Combat: Ogrillons thrived in combat and were uncomfortable and restless if not in a battle.
document_data.History: As of [[1370 DR]], ogrillons were one of the many creatures used as slaves in [[Menzoberranzan]]. At some point, the second house of Menzoberranzan ([[House Barrison Del'Armgo]]) owned roughly 250 slave ogrillons.
document_data.Notable ogrillons:
;[[Ragnor]]
:Ragnor was a fighter and one of the military leaders of [[Castle Trinity]].
;[[Grguch]]
:Grguch was the leader of the ogrillion tribe known as [[Clan Karuck]].
;[[Hakuun]]
:Hakuun was the shaman of the ogrillon tribe Clan Karuck. Around [[1372 DR]], Hakuun became the chief advisor to the clan's leader, Grguch.
